intro: Moraea villosa, commonly known as the woolly moraea, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves, which give it its common name. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Moraea villosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique floral structure and long blooming period.
